sentences.sentence: The European Parliament and EU member states reached an agreement on Tuesday on how to boost the supply of semiconductors in Europe as the bloc races to reduce its dependency on Asian suppliers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The aim is to be sure that in a situation where there is a crisis like the one we experienced last year with the war in Ukraine, we will be able to ensure a minimum level of the chips production in the European Union and also to work very closely with like-minded partners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: closely with like-minded partners. Asian industry, especially firms in China and Taiwan, currently dominate the manufacture and export of semiconductors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Under the agreement, the EU aims to double its current global market share to 20 percent in 2030 and mobilize more than 43 billion euros in public and private investments to feed Europe's growing appetite for chips.
